thread.title: Anthony Martial addresses Manchester United future
thread.title_full: Anthony Martial addresses Manchester United future

author: Samuel Luckhurst
title: Anthony Martial addresses Manchester United future
text:
Sport Anthony Martial addresses Manchester United future Man Utd news includes an update from Anthony Martial on his future amid reports of a possible transfer to PSG. Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Mourinho remembers the last time was sat in this chair Share this video Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Anthony Martial claims it is 'wrong' he could leave Manchester United in the summer transfer window. 
The 21-year-old was an unused substitute for the second successive game at Leicester on Sunday and has started just one Premier League match this calendar year. 
Jose Mourinho promised Martial he would start against Hull five days ago if he performed 'magnificently' in the FA Cup tie versus Wigan, but the Frenchman's two assists were not enough. 
Reports have suggested Martial could move to Ligue 1 champions Paris Saint-Germain at the end of the campaign but the France international attempted to clarify his future. 
"Don't listen [to] the papers it's wrong thanks Come on United," Martial tweeted. 
Martial rarely speaks to the written or broadcast media after matches and once tried to disguise himself in the mixed zone by pulling his hood almost entirely over his face. Read More Mkhitaryan allows Mourinho to play his favourite formation 
Mourinho touched upon his decisions not to start Martial in United's recent Premier League fixtures. 
"Your perspective is that if a player is not playing, the manager is disturbing him," he said during his post-match press conference during Leicester. 
"But it’s not true. Sometimes you don’t play players and you protect them. Mkhi was being protected. He was adapting. You see the magic things on the pitch and I see other things that I want to see."
